context:
As a retired Electronics Engineer and Software Engineer this article spun my head directly into counter-counter-measures for this effort on the part of the US military. "Ridiculously simple" comes to mind. Technology I worked on in the 1970s could render their efforts at jamming ineffective. Most of the ECCM efforts problems would be making the sensors, antennas, and power drain small enough. Single chip radios are possible. So that's a major portion of the issue. Even optical "radios" are small enough now. Physical disruption is about the only effective approach I can see.

{^_^}
